definition: to fill or stuff/(of a form etc) to fill in

sentences.english: Some teachers tend to spoon-feed their students.
sentences.chinese: 有些教師往往填鴨式地教育他們的學生。

sentences.english: Don't cram the night before the exam.
sentences.chinese: 不要在考試前夜填鴨式惡補。
填鴨式授課還是互動式教學？

sentences.english: Such cramming method of teaching is now severely reprobated.
sentences.chinese: 這種填鴨式的教學法現在受到嚴厲的譴責。

sentences.english: You can spoon-feed information to a computer.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把各種信息填鴨式地輸入計算機。

sentences.english: China has also expanded school access, and moved away from learning by rote.
sentences.chinese: 中國還提高了入學率，走出了填鴨式教學的定式。

sentences.english: We seek to re-write the programming that you have tried to indoctrinate us with since the moment we were born.
sentences.chinese: 我們企圖改寫你們自出生就填鴨式灌輸給我們的規則。

sentences.english: It is wrong to spoon feed the students.
sentences.chinese: 對學生進行填鴨式教育是錯誤的。

sentences.english: But in our country, many teachers still adopted " force-feed type" the teaching method.
sentences.chinese: 而在我國，不少教師仍然採取“填鴨式”的教學方法。

sentences.english: Instructors still use the force-feeding method of teaching during the ordinary teaching process.
sentences.chinese: 教師在平時教學中仍然沿用傳統的填鴨式方法。

sentences.english: The teacher tried to cram his pupils.
sentences.chinese: 老師試圖用填鴨式教學把知識灌輸給學生。

sentences.english: Teachers in a spoon-feeding classroom simply dictate information and answers.
sentences.chinese: 在填鴨式教學中，老師只是口授信息和答案。

sentences.english: SEO is cramming instead of studying.
They were less willing to be spoon-fed doctrines from Japan.
sentences.chinese: 他們不太願意被填鴨式地灌輸來自日本的學說。

definition: One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
Ruyuan Yao Autonomous County in Shaoguan 韶關|韶关[Shao2 guan1], Guangdong
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
